project.teaser: Ł-PORT in Wrocław is a young government institution that conducts cutting-edge research and promotes the commercialisation of scientific discoveries. The aim of the Twinning project is to place the Life Science and Biotechnology Centre (LS&BC) of Ł-PORT in an international...
project.objective: Ł-PORT in Wrocław is a young government institution that conducts cutting-edge research and promotes the commercialisation of scientific discoveries. The aim of the Twinning project is to place the Life Science and Biotechnology Centre (LS&BC) of Ł-PORT in an international network of European biomedical research. This will be achieved by intensifying collaboration with leading neuroscience centres from France, Germany and the Netherlands. The scientific focus of this initiative stems from the shared vision of the consortium partners to develop new solutions for neuropsychiatric diseases. It is estimated that 27% of the EU adult population suffers from at least one mental disorder. These statistics are largely due to inadequate understanding of the biological basis of the disease, leading to suboptimal therapies. Recent studies have discovered numerous genetic risk factors for mental disorders. The next step is to investigate their contribution to disease-related phenotypes using Standardized Approaches to Modelling and Examination of Neuropsychiatric Disorders. The SAME-NeuroID aims to adopt in Ł-PORT the methods developed in the partner laboratories, in order to achieve a consistent experimental workflow to facilitate the discovery and validation of new therapies. Consortium partners will support the LS&BC in boosting the technical skills and management excellence, while educational resources will be utilized to accelerate the formation of the next generation of well-trained scientists. Interdisciplinary activities will be organized to disseminate the unified toolbox and cross-pollinate the existing academic and commercial environments. A comprehensive communication campaign for promoting our results among stakeholders will increase the competitiveness and visibility of Ł-PORT in the international research community. Collectively, the SAME-NeuroID will be a true milestone for positioning LS&BCŁ-PORT as a new hub of excellence for neuroscience in the ERA landscape.
project.title: Standardized Approaches to Modelling and Examination of Neuropsychiatric Disorders
project.keywords: Neuropsychiatric disorders, Standard Operating Procedures, IPSC, animal models, behaviour, training

result.title: The SAME-NeuroID project website launched
result.description: Creation and regular updates of SAME-NeuroID project, which will be a main tool for communication in the project. The indicators of the deliverable are the number of WWW visits and number of contacts created through the website, particularly active network of young investigators in the field.

result.title: Communication & Dissemination & Exploitation Plan
result.description: All communication activities will be specified in the CDP. It will be structured for key messages tailored to specific target audience: Industry stakeholders /academic partners /policy makers / general public and will be equiped with communication tools for general use and target audience to provide for stakeholder engagement to be reached through respective communication channels. Dissemination activities in the CDP will be organized in the best manner to accelerate distributions of Research Articles and presentations in order to enhance excellence and improve reputation and visibility of Ł-PORT.

result.title: Mid-term of Excellence schools agenda feedback and Outgoing travel grants agreements for 21 participants
result.description: Travel grant agreements and school timetables that will be in place until week 16 of the project. These will be successively updated during the second half of the project.

result.title: Portfolio of materials for all target groups
result.description: Production of dedicated communication materials will be prepared to reach respective stakeholders. For general use, a project logo, flyers, movies and information sheets will be prepared. Templates for press releases and slide presentations will be provided to all partners. For all events (Summer School, Worskhops, PORT for Health,etc.) materials will be designed and distributed among the target audience.

result.title: Conference materials of PORT for Health: Neuroscience
result.description: Two meetings (PORT for Health: Neuroscience) will be organised on to ensure constant updates on scientific progress in the field. PORT for Health Conferences are organised every year in a two-year cycle in the following order: Oncology and Neuroscience. Next, PORT for Health: Neuroscience will be organised in September 2023 (in the 12th month of the Twinning project) and the second one in September 2025 (in the 36th month of the Twinning project). Materials documenting the conferences (website, videos, etc.) will be prepared.

result.title: Recruitment procedure for Excellence Schools
result.description: The participation of doctoral students in schools organised by partner organisations and short term visits is planned. Special procedures for selecting suitable candidates for such trips will be developed and approved by the Steering Committee.

result.title: Kick-off meeting report
result.description: Report describes administrative and financial management – overall consortium management, structure for 1) chairing all consortium meetings includinglogistic supports; 2) timeline for reporting to EC; reviewing the progress and quality of deliverables (including maintenance of data repository, archives, logs); 3) monitoring and documenting the work plan; milestones and indicators, including resource allocation; 4) project achievements (based on the DMP and IPR generated within the project). 5) management of the funds.

details.authors: Joeri, Bordes; Lucas, Miranda; Bertram, Müller-Myhsok; Mathias V, Schmidt

result.title: Tab on project website for active network of young investigators in the field
result.description: A scientific retreat/seminar for PhD students is planned to create a network of PhD students. They will create a bookmark from this event for the project website.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Throughout the project, the FAIR principles will be implemented as an integral part of the proposed methodology for research data management. Detailed Data Management Plan will be established at the beginning of the project with the contribution of all consortium partners and regularly updated.

result.title: Ethical permissions issued
result.description: All relevant ethical issues (Ethical permissions for conducting studies with human material), will be concluded in the form of ethical permissions for conducting studies. The documents will be presented on the the project Website.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
